titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Joy L. Leonard, Class of 1911, Yale College, Photograph Album Documenting Yale and New Haven
Leonard (Joy Luther), Class of 1911, Yale College, Photograph Album Documenting Yale and New Haven
titlestmt.author: compiled by Christine Connolly

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday January 11, 2019 at 09:33

did.unittitle: Joy L. Leonard, Class of 1911, Yale College, photograph albumdocumenting Yale and New Haven

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The album consists of photographs of buildings and grounds of Yale and New Haven, Connecticut taken on February 23, 1913. It documents Joy L. Leonard's (Yale 1911) guided tour of New Haven, accompanied by Charlotte Marsh, for his guests Lucy Harris and James Roberts of New York City. Leonard later gave the album to his guests as a souvenir of their trip. Of particular note are images of the Sheffield Scientific School campus, the athletic fields in Westville, Old Campus and its environs, the New Haven Green, and a fold-out map of the city, with annotations.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 48-A (YRG 48-A), Yale pictorial records and collections.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The material was a gift of Doris L. Rau, 2003.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Joy L. Leonard, Class of 1911, Yale College, Photograph Album Documenting Yale and New Haven (RU 923). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The album consists of photographs of buildings and grounds of Yale and New Haven, Connecticut taken on February 23, 1913. It documents Joy L. Leonard's (Yale 1911) guided tour of New Haven, accompanied by Charlotte Marsh, for his guests Lucy Harris and James Roberts of New York City. Leonard later gave the album to his guests as a souvenir of their trip. Of particular note are images of the Sheffield Scientific School campus, the athletic fields in Westville, Old Campus and its environs, the New Haven Green, and a fold-out map of the city, with annotations.
